title: Technical Program Manager - Supplier Carbon Solutions
summary: Today, Apple is carbon neutral for our corporate operations. Since achieving this goal in 2020, we've set an even more ambitious goal — to make our products carbon neutral by 2030, across our entire supply chain and the lifetime energy use of our customers’ devices. The Supplier Carbon Solutions Program will help meet Apple’s 2030 goal by transitioning suppliers to carbon neutrality for their Apple-related operations.
description:
- Craft, set and oversee delivery of the technical Supplier Carbon Solutions vision & strategy
- Build and prioritize an ambitious but iterative product roadmap that balances user/team needs with business and stakeholder priorities
- Deeply understand and empathize with users’ needs and pain points
- Collaborate with cross functional developers and business teams to identify, propose, and craft technical solutions that are user-friendly, scalable, and address these needs
- Support tool implementation, improvements, maintenance, data quality, and training
- Deliver experiences that are delightful to use and support the Supplier Carbon Solutions team achieve their goal to transition Apple suppliers to carbon neutrality for their Apple-related operations
- Lead internal working groups and external vendors to deliver high-quality data that drives action
preferred_qualifications:
10+ years of technical program management experience, ensuring that program needs are met through defining and ensuring the delivery of complex internal tools and systems
5+ years experience working with software product teams, in a product role
Able to think creatively, understand details, and also see the big picture to design a data and tools strategy that meets the needs of the Supplier Carbon Solutions team and is in line with the broader organizational goals
Comfort leading internal cross-functional teams and external technical vendors to execute strategy, noting that internal software development resources sit outside of the Supplier Carbon Solutions team
Demonstrated ability to understand complex business processes, to craft and effectively communicate a product vision, strategy, and roadmap, and to inspire the product team to execute upon these artifacts
Clear and concise communicator across multiple audiences and partners; able to explain technical details in business terms and vice versa
Able to work closely with cross-functional technical teams, engage in thoughtful and respectful debate, and prioritize among competing needs
Attention to detail and strong analytical skills to support near-term business requests as longer-term tool development is in process
Able to independently manage multiple initiatives, effectively prioritizing tasks to meet deadlines while balancing progress towards longer-term strategic goals
Experience performing and supervising data analysis and can lean into new AI/ML capabilities to ensure the highest quality data
Experience with customer relationship management systems, data visualization tools, and relational databases
Experience with environmental metrics (such as GHG reporting protocols and carbon accounting) is not required - but you must have an interest in learning about these areas and becoming deeply familiar with this domain
